intro: Thermopsis kaxgarica, commonly known as the Kaxgar poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
